Key to the genera of Poaceae

leads.lead_text: Leaf-blades stiff, often inrolled, sharp-pointed and glabrous; auricles not well-developed (up to c. 1 mm long); glumes obtuse to acute; lemmas awnless, thick and rigid; plants usually quite glaucous, mostly coastal

Leaf-blades flat, hairy on the upper surface; auricles usually well-developed and partly encircling stem (mostly >1 mm long); glumes acute to shortly awned; lemmas usually shortly awned, firm but not thick; plants green, coastal and inland sites
